All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<org.biojava3.core.sequence.compound.NucleotideCompound>, org.biojava3.core.sequence.template.Accessioned, org.biojava3.core.sequence.template.Sequence<org.biojava3.core.sequence.compound.NucleotideCompound>
public class Oligo
extends org.biojava3.core.sequence.DNASequence

Oligo object Similar to a simple Base Pair DNA Sequence with some other tweaks

Author:
Samir Ahmed

OligoFactory

public static Oligo OligoFactory(java.lang.String genome,
                                 Target tt)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Oligo Factory, Given a genome, and a target. The oligo factory will return the desired Oligo object defined by the parameters of the target object.

Parameters:
genome - A genome of sufficient length
tt - A target mutation object
Returns:
An unoptimized oligomer to perform the target mutation
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

MismatchFactory

public static Oligo MismatchFactory(java.lang.String genome,
                                    java.lang.String target,
                                    int left_position,
                                    int right_position,
                                    int replichore,
                                    boolean sense,
                                    java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Defines a mismatch on a surface.

Parameters:
genome - The genome from which the oligo is being made
target - The target sequence that will be put onto the genome
left_position - The left position, indicating the point at which the mutation will be inserted into the genome
right_position - The end position of where the oligo is to cut off
replichore - The replichore 1 or 2
sense - True if sense is postive and false if negative
name - The name of this target
Returns:
Returns a oligo defined by the input parameters
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - In the event that oligo is incompletely/improperly specified

DeletionFactory

public static Oligo DeletionFactory(java.lang.String genome,
                                    int left_position,
                                    int right_position,
                                    int replichore,
                                    java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Deletion factory generates and an oligo that represents a deletion

Parameters:
genome - The genome from which the oligo is being made
target - The target sequence that will be put onto the genome
left_position - The left position, indicating the point at which the mutation will be cut off
replichore - The replichore 1 or 2
right_position - an Integer to specify the position at which the genome is to be cut out again.
name - The name of this target
Returns:
Returns a oligo defined by the input parameters
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - In the event that oligo is incompletely/improperly specified

replichore - The replichore 1 or 2
sense - True if sense is postive and false if negative
name - The name of this target
Returns:

getOligo

private java.lang.String getOligo(int start_position)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Returns an oligo that is the subset of the span. e.g 
 
 oligo.getOligo(1)	//will return an oligo of the first n base pairs for n = ideal length of oligo. 
 oligo.getOligo(0)	//will throw an error, because the first position is 1.
 oligo.getOligo(314)	//will throw an error, given that it indexes outside the range of the span of the oligo.

Parameters:
start_position - An integer representing the starting position of the oligo of ideal length
Returns:
An oligo of ideal length
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the oligo is outside the bounds of the span, and error is thrown

public int getOligoId()
Every oligo has a unique static id number

Returns:
An integer holding the unique id number of the referenced oligo

public void set(int new_start_position)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Shift Optimized takes the current span, extracts a subsequence from the desired starting position

It creates and oligo of ideal length and then updates the mistargets associated with the oligo
